html:
wandering bird cast out of the nest. The Moabites (or "daughters of Moab") who survive the destruction (chapter 15) wander through the land like a nestling who has lost its nest.

fords of Arnon. Many Moabites gather at the fords of Arnon, perhaps because there is water there to take care of their needs. Arnon, now called Wadi el-Mujib, is Moab's chief river. It flows into the Dead Sea.
